worldContext.name: The Berg
worldContext.description: Two colonies of super penguins survive on a frozen ice berg. They trade, worship, use magic and advanced technology, and fend off the occasional Orca Raid.
worldContext.tone: Evocative and mystical without being overly flowery. Like the style of modern fantasy authors like brandon sanderson or patrick rothfus. avoid using too many adverbs and adjectives like dense prose of older fantasy like jrr tolkien.  descriptions and image should be as if create 'in universe' by penguins looking back on history.

description.instructions:
Write a description that emerges from who this entity IS and what they're CONNECTED to.

Use the provided relationships to ground the description - if they're allied with a faction, that shapes who they are. If they have rivals, hint at tension. If they're a member of something, show belonging.

The entity's prominence ({{entity.prominence}}) should calibrate the scope:
- mythic/renowned: World-shaping, widely known, legendary qualities
- recognized: Notable within their sphere, respected or feared
- marginal/forgotten: Intimate scale, personal details, local significance

Consider their age in the world ({{entityAge}}) - ancient entities carry history, new ones have fresh energy.
description.tone: Match the world's tone ({{world.tone}}) but let the entity's nature lead. A grim warlord in a whimsical world creates interesting contrast. Write with specificity - name actual connections, reference the culture, ground details in the world of {{world.name}}.
description.outputFormat: 2-3 sentences. Dense with meaning, grounded in specifics. Name at least one relationship or cultural detail when relevant.

image.imageInstructions: Create concept art that captures this entity's essence. Focus on the individual traits and visual identity provided. The image should feel like it belongs in an illustrated bestiary or game art book.
image.avoidElements: Text, labels, watermarks, UI elements. Modern clothing or technology. Multiple versions of the same subject. Blurry or low-quality rendering. Human features on penguins. Contradicting the visual identity. Flipper/wing gestures as primary identifying element (raised flipper, wing pressed to chest, arms folded). Generic upright poses without distinctive equipment or markings. Body language alone as visual thesis - require structural elements like headgear, armor, tools, magical effects, scars, or clothing.

image.imageInstructions: The main subject is a CHARACTER. Create a portrait that showcases their individual traits as the focal point. The character should feel like a distinct individual, not a generic representative of their species or role.

The main subject is a PLACE. Create an environmental shot that captures the atmosphere and character of this location. Include architectural or natural details that make it feel like a real, lived-in space.

The main subject is an ORGANIZATION. Choose one of: a council of leaders, the faction's headquarters, their banner or symbol, or a representative member in ceremonial attire. The image should convey collective identity and purpose.
The main subject is an EVENT. Create a dramatic scene capturing the pivotal moment. Show the action as if witnessed firsthand - triumphant, tragic, or transformative.

The main subject is a TIME PERIOD. Create a symbolic or panoramic scene that captures the spirit of this era. Use visual metaphor - rising sun, gathering storm, crumbling walls - to convey the age's defining mood.
The main subject is an OBJECT or artifact. Create a focused study with dramatic lighting. Show fine details, materials, and any magical properties. The artifact should be the clear focal point.
The main subject is a MAGICAL POWER or ability. Focus on the manifestation of the power itself, not on characters using it. Show energy, effects, or the visual signature of this magic in action.
The main subject is a MAGICAL SYSTEM or rule. Create an abstract or symbolic representation that conveys how this magic works - perhaps glyphs, energy flows, or the interaction of elemental forces.

orca.SPECIES: Apex predators. Size and scarification vary by role - raiders lean and scarred, shamans massive and unmarked, warriors somewhere between. Posture ranges from coiled ambush stillness to rigid military display.
orca.ARCHITECTURE: No permanent structures. Temporary hunting camps marked by kelp-rope barriers, bone totems, skull warnings. Sacred spaces are natural formations claimed, not built.
orca.TECH: Ocean-current weaponry - shock-lances, current-whips, pressure harpoons. Equipment is brutal and functional. Trophy display varies: some drape kills, others maintain austere discipline.
orca.MAGIC: Blood and pressure. Rituals leave physical marks - scarification, tooth-notching, fin-splitting. Magic manifests as water distortion, pressure waves, cold spots. Dead god symbols are ancient, half-forgotten, inconsistently applied.

nightshelf.SPECIES: Cave-adapted penguins. Builds range from compact tunnel-runners to broader cavern-dwellers. Bone and crystal mark status but placement varies - some favor crowns, others belts, others hidden talismans. Dress ranges from heavy wrappings to minimal stealth-wear.
nightshelf.ARCHITECTURE: Subterranean networks mixing natural caverns and carved tunnels. Bioluminescent accents and fire-braziers for light. Sacred spaces go deeper and darker. Public areas glow; private areas don't.
nightshelf.TECH: Captured elemental fire drives everything - braziers, forges, engines. Steampunk aesthetic but visibility varies: lamp-bearers are obvious, shadow-workers hide their gear. Bone integrated as structural material and decoration.
nightshelf.MAGIC: Ice and fire in tension. Practical applications over spectacle. Magic users often understated - subtle warmth, quiet frost. Rituals happen in darkness. Effects are felt before seen.

aurora-stack.SPECIES: Open-ice penguins. Posture tends tall and proud but varies by role - merchants bustle, mystics stand still, soldiers brace. Crystalline ice integrated into equipment at varying degrees - some carry staves, others wear jewelry, others embed it in armor or tools.
aurora-stack.ARCHITECTURE: Vertical ice spires with open-air galleries designed to catch aurora-light. Elegant and organic-looking but clearly engineered. Public spaces soar; private quarters are modest cells within the ice.
aurora-stack.TECH: Ice-magic fusion powers everything. Crystalline conductors, aurora-charged capacitors. Prefer blunt and crushing weapons to blades. Airship crews dress for wind; wall-builders dress for cold; merchants dress for impression.
aurora-stack.MAGIC: Pure ice channeling. Adepts glow faintly from within - intensity varies by power level. Magic manifests as crystalline growth, temperature drops, aurora-reflection. Mundane members show no glow but may carry charged equipment.

world.SPECIES: The Berg itself - supernatural iceberg of impossible scale. Weather is entity, not backdrop.
world.ARCHITECTURE: Natural ice formations that seem almost intentional. Crevasses, spires, shelves, grottos. The berg shifts slowly over generations.
world.TECH: None. The world is pre-technological, post-magical.
world.MAGIC: Ambient and ancient. The ice remembers. Aurora-light carries power. The cold thinks.

enrichmentConfig.claudeImagePromptTemplate:
Transform the below knowledge graph into a single, coherent image prompt for {{modelName}}. Do NOT simply reformat—actively synthesize and reshape:

Extract the core visual essence: Identify the single most compelling visual moment or aspect of this entity. Discard extraneous metadata.
Translate non-visual data into visual directives:

Convert abstract concepts (magic, history, relationships) into concrete visual metaphors
Turn status/prominence into visual hierarchy and focus
Make any fantastical/non-standard elements explicit visual directives (size, material, form)

Build a coherent artistic vision: Combine STYLE + SUBJECT + TONE into a unified visual strategy. Make these reinforce each other, not just coexist.
Establish clear composition and perspective:

Choose a specific vantage point (macro, wide-establishing, intimate detail, aerial, etc.)
Decide what the viewer is meant to feel spatially
Use environmental storytelling (objects, weathering, traces) to convey history

Create specific visual instructions: Rather than listing adjectives, use concrete visual language: "weathered by decades of X," "visible scars of Y," "rendered in the style of Z but with the emotional weight of W"
Condense to a single, authoritative prompt: Output should be 150-300 words, reading as a clear artistic direction that could be handed to a concept artist—not a bulleted list or knowledge base entry.
